title: What should I write in my common app essay if I don't have any thing special to tell admission committee about? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you’ve never done something special, go do something special. Then you’ll have something to write about. I’ve known students who will spend hours every week reading about how to write good essays, and reading sample essays. And it’s like… Five hours a week, every week. You could have created something. You could have done something. You could have learned something. Instead, you manufactured an inauthentic essay that’s not going to impress anyone. Colleges don’t like applicants who say stuff. They like applicants who do stuff.
